title: 2021 in the United States
added: === November ===
*November 24 – [[Walt Disney Animation Studios]]' 60th feature film, ''[[Encanto (film)|Encanto]]'', will be released in theatres.

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *January 10 – [[Amazon (company)|Amazon]] will suspend [[Parler]] from [[Amazon Web Services]], making Parler unavailable unless it can find a new hosting provider.<ref>{{cite news|title= Amazon Is Booting Parler Off Of Its Web Hosting Service|url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/johnpaczkowski/amazon-parler-aws|work=[[BuzzFeed News]]|date=January 9, 2021|accessdate=January 10, 2021|author=Paczkowski, John}}</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *May 7 – After a series of delays due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], ''[[Black Widow (2021 film)|Black Widow]]'', directed by [[Cate Shortland]], is scheduled to be released by [[Marvel Studios]] as the 24th film of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) and the first film in its "[[Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Four|Phase Four]]" slate.

*July 9 – ''[[Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings]]'', directed by [[Destin Daniel Cretton]], is scheduled to be released by [[Marvel Studios]] as the 25th film of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU).

*November 5 – After a series of delays due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], ''[[Eternals (film)|Eternals]]'', directed by [[Chloé Zhao]], is scheduled to be released by [[Marvel Studios]] as the 26th film of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU).
=== December ===

*December 17 – The [[Untitled Spider-Man: Far From Home sequel|untitled ''Spider-Man: Far From Home'' sequel]], directed by [[Jon Watts]], is scheduled to be released by [[Marvel Studios]] and [[Columbia Pictures]] as the 27th film of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) and the sequel to 2017's ''[[Spider-Man: Homecoming]]'' and 2019's ''[[Spider-Man: Far from Home]]''.

title: 2021 in the United States
deleted: *December 13- Karmen Sullivan was her 13th birthday, and it was almost no fun like her other past birthdays.

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *[[January 12]] – The Justice Department tells a press conference that cases have been opened on 170 people linked to the [[2021_storming_of_the_United_States_Capitol|storming of the U.S. Capitol]], with 70 charged so far, a number expected to grow into the "hundreds," with many facing charges of [[sedition]] carrying up to 20 years in prison.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2021/01/12/Capitol-riot-Justice-Department-expects-sedition-charges-20-year-sentences/2721610479706/|title=Capitol riot: Justice Department expects sedition charges, 20-year sentences|date=January 12, 2021|accessdate=January 13, 2021|work=UPI}}</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
deleted: *March 5 – [[Walt Disney Animation Studios]]' 59th feature film, ''[[Raya and the Last Dragon]]'', will be simultaneously released in theatres and on [[Disney+]] with Premier Access due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].

*May 7 – After a series of delays due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], ''[[Black Widow (2021 film)|Black Widow]]'', directed by [[Cate Shortland]], is scheduled to be released by [[Marvel Studios]] as the 24th film of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU) and the first film in its "[[Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Four|Phase Four]]" slate.

*July 9 – ''[[Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings]]'', directed by [[Destin Daniel Cretton]], is scheduled to be released by [[Marvel Studios]] as the 25th film of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU).

*November 5 – After a series of delays due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], ''[[Eternals (film)|Eternals]]'', directed by [[Chloé Zhao]], is scheduled to be released by [[Marvel Studios]] as the 26th film of the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] (MCU).
*November 24 – [[Walt Disney Animation Studios]]' 60th feature film, ''[[Encanto (film)|Encanto]]'', will be released in theatres.

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *[[January 19]] – COVID-19 pandemic – The country's death toll from COVID-19 surpasses 400,000.<ref>[https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-19-death-toll-400k-united-states/ COVID-19 death toll tops 400,000 as incoming CDC director expects "dark weeks ahead"] CBS News, January 19, 2021</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *[[January 19]] – COVID-19 pandemic:The country's death toll from COVID-19 surpasses 400,000.<ref>[https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-19-death-toll-400k-united-states/ COVID-19 death toll tops 400,000 as incoming CDC director expects "dark weeks ahead"] CBS News, January 19, 2021</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *[[January 19]]

**COVID-19 pandemic: The country's death toll from COVID-19 surpasses 400,000.<ref>[https://www.cbsnews.com/news/covid-19-death-toll-400k-united-states/ COVID-19 death toll tops 400,000 as incoming CDC director expects "dark weeks ahead"] CBS News, January 19, 2021</ref>

**On his last full day in office, President Trump [[List of people granted executive clemency by Donald Trump|issues pardons]] for over 100 people, mostly allies and friends.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jan/18/trump-warned-against-self-pardon-white-house-officials-reports Trump to issue more than 100 pardons before Biden sworn in] ''The Guardian'', January 18, 2021</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: **[[Chief Administrator of the Courts|Chief Administrator of Court Administration]] employee Brendan Hunt is arrested by the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] in [[Queens]] for encouraging the public executions of members of [[United States Congress|Congress]] on social media between December 6 and January 12.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Dienst|first=Jonathan|last2=Santia|first2=Marc|last3=Valiquette|first3=Joe|date=2020-01-19|title=Feds: NY Court Worker Called for ‘Public Executions' of Top Dems in Online Posts|url=https://www.nbcnewyork.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/man-accused-of-threatening-elected-officials-online-is-arrested-in-queens-source/2837459/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-01-20|website=[[WNBC|NBC New York]]|language=}}</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: * [[January 20]]
** Inauguration of Joe Biden as the 46th President of the United States.
** Trump is the first outgoing president not to attend his successor's inauguration since Andrew Johnson in 1869.

title: 2021 in the United States
added: ** Inauguration of Joe Biden as the[[46th President of the United States]].

** Trump is the first outgoing president not to attend his successor's inauguration since Andrew Johnson in 1869.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/19/us/politics/presidents-who-skipped-inaugurations.html Trump Is Not the First President to Snub an Inauguration] ''The New York Times'', January 19, 2021</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
deleted: *[[January 29]] – [[COVID-19 pandemic in Michigan]]: The [[University of Michigan]] announces 11 of its [[Michigan Wolverines|student-athletes]] have tested positive for the [[Variant of Concern 202012/01|UK variant]] of COVID-19. All sports activities at the school remain on hiatus until February 6.<ref>[https://www.freep.com/story/sports/college/university-michigan/wolverines/2021/01/29/michigan-athletics-coronavirus-update/4311544001/ Michigan athletic department: 11 positive COVID tests this week] ''Detroit Free Press'', January 29, 2021</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *[[February 2]] – Following the allegations of the previous day, Marilyn Manson is dropped by his record label, [[Loma Vista Recordings]]. He is also removed from a guest appearance in the drama ''[[American_Gods_(TV_series)|American Gods]]''.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-55900061 |title=Marilyn Manson dropped by record label over abuse allegations |date=February 2, 2021|access-date=February 2, 2021|work=BBC News}}</ref>

added: *[[February 2]] – Following the allegations of the previous day, Marilyn Manson is dropped by his record label, [[Loma Vista Recordings]]. He is also removed fromtwoTVshows,''[[American_Gods_(TV_series)|American Gods]]'' and ''[[Creepshow_(TV_series)|Creepshow]]''.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-55900061 |title=Marilyn Manson dropped by record label over abuse allegations |date=February 2, 2021|access-date=February 2, 2021|work=BBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2021/feb/02/marilyn-manson-removed-from-us-tv-shows-following-abuse-allegations |title=Marilyn Manson removed from US TV shows following abuse allegations |date=February 2, 2021|access-date=February 2, 2021|work=The Guardian}}</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: **[[Muskogee home shooting]]: Five children and one adult were shot and killed, and one adult was injured (with a life-threatening injuries), after a home shooting in Oklahoma.<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=February 2, 2021|title=Police: 5 children, 1 adult fatally shot at Oklahoma home|url=https://apnews.com/article/muskogee-shootings-police-tulsa-oklahoma-3b7f0fb355d18a379ca5192d01e53cfc|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=February 2, 2021|website=Associated Press}}</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *February 1–2: A [[February 2021 nor'easter|major nor'easter]] strikes [[New England]]. The highest record snowfall amount, {{convert|33|in|cm}}, was recorded in [[Nazareth, Pennsylvania]].<ref>[https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2021/02/02/weather-snowfall-totals-winter-storm-new-england-new-york/4351996001/ Winter storm heads into New England; New Yorkers dig out; biggest snowfall total 33 inches in Pa.] ''USA Today'', February 2, 2021</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
deleted: **Aftermath of the 2021 storming of the United States Capitol: Acting [[United States Attorney for the District of Columbia|US Attorney of the District Columbia]] [[Michael R. Sherwin]] announces that 400 suspects have been identified and 135 people have been charged in connection to the storming of the [[United States Capitol]].<ref>[https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/doj-identified-400-suspects-charged-135-capitol-riot/story?id=754971133 DOJ has identified 400 suspects, charged 135 in Capitol riot] ABC News, January 26, 2021 </ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *[[February 7]] - The [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] win [[Super Bowl LV]], defeating the [[Kansas City Chiefs]], making them the first wildcard team to win the [[Super Bowl]] since the [[2010 Green Bay Packers season|2010 Green Bay Packers]].<ref>https://www.bbc.com/sport/american-football/55975394</ref>

title: 2021 in the United States
added: *[[February 7]] - The [[2020 Tampa Bay Buccaneers season|Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] win [[Super Bowl LV]], defeating the [[2020 Kansas City Chiefs season|Kansas City Chiefs]]31–9, making them the first wildcard team to win the [[Super Bowl]] since the [[2010 Green Bay Packers season|2010 Green Bay Packers]]and the first to win it in their home stadium.<ref>[https://www.bbc.com/sport/american-football/55975394Super Bowl 2021: Tom Brady wins seventh title as Tampa Bay Buccaneers beat Kansas City Chiefs] BBC, February 7, 2021</ref>
